si.t: Start the process at AppDev Studio
Number of steps complete by status:

r.t: Test Stage: Cases when changing workitem opening option (new window vs modal popup)

si.t: Click on Project Manager from top toolbar
Name field displays entered text 'Simple Form'
Description field displays entered text 'Simple Form'
Modal closes, and 'Simple Form' workspace is created
Click 'Simple Form' workspace from the list
Name and Description of the workspace is shown
Modal closes, and 'Simple Form' project is created
Name and Description of the project is shown
Name field displays entered text 'Personal Information'
Description field displays entered text 'Personal Information'
Modal closes, and 'Personal Information' form is created
Name field displays entered text 'Extend CSS&JS Block'
Description field displays entered text 'Extend CSS&JS Block'
Modal closes, and 'Extend CSS&JS Block' block is created
Alreardy created own workspace / project / form / block at the Project Manager
Start the process at Data Modeler. You can open Data Modeler by clicking the small button at top left of AppDev (AppDev's Studio to be specific)
Click on the 'new entity' button at the top of the 'entity/group' window
Name field displays entered text 'First Name'
Description field displays entered text 'First Name'
Dropdown displays String as selected value and data length entry appears
Data Length field displays entered text '100'
Name field displays entered text 'Middle Name'
Description field displays entered text 'Middle Name'
Name field displays entered text 'Last Name'
Description field displays entered text 'Last Name'
Name field displays entered text 'Full Name'
Enter 'Last Name+,+Middle Name+First Name' as description
Description field displays entered text 'Last Name+,+Middle Name+First Name'
Dropdown displays Lookup as selected value and 'Lookup' dropdown appears
Dependency check box is checked, and 'Dependency Entity' dropdown appears
Dropdown displays State as selected value
Name field displays entered text 'Zip Code'
Description field displays entered text 'Zip Code'
Dropdown displays Integer as selected value
Data Length field displays entered text '20'
Name field displays entered text 'Email Address'
Description field displays entered text 'Email Address'
Name field displays entered text 'Date of Birth'
Description field displays entered text 'Date of Birth'
Dropdown displays Date as selected value
Click 'Save' button at the top of the window
Alreardy created own workspace / project / form / block at the Project Manager
Start the process at Data Modeler - Component Tab
List of component groups appears on Component List
Fields expands, and components under 'Fields' are shown
Component name appears beside the entity and Preview displays the component
Click 'Apply' on the buttom of the window
Calendar expands, and components under 'Calendar' are shown
All entities are mapped with components
Start the process at Data Modeler - Relationship Tab
Able to type in 'Relation Name' and 'Description' field
Relation Name field displays entered text 'Full Name'
Enter 'Generate full name with first, middle and last name' to description
Description field displays entered text 'Generate full name with first, middle and last name'
Drag 'First Name' to 'Drag here to add(Source)'
Drag 'Middle Name' to 'Drag here to add(Source)'
Drag 'Last Name' to 'Drag here to add(Source)'
Drag 'Full Name' to 'Drag here to add(Target)'
Function field and target dropdown appear under Calculation
Click 'Apply' on the buttom of the window
Click Save button top right of the modeler panel
Click Publisth buutton top right of the modeler panel
Able to type in 'Relation Name' and 'Description' field
Relation Name field displays entered text 'Address'
Enter 'Generate address with State, City and Zip Code' to description
Description field displays entered text 'Generate address with State, City and Zip Code'
Drag 'Zip Code' to 'Drag here to add(Source)'
Relation Name field displays entered text 'Age'
Enter 'Automatically calculate age when date of birth is selected' to description
Description field displays entered text 'Automatically calculate age when date of birth is selected
Drag 'Date of Birth' to 'Drag here to add(Source)'
Date of Birth' is added as 'source.a'
Function field and target dropdown appear under Validation
Start the process at Data Modeler - Validation Tab
Drag 'First Name' to Drop here entity
Entity Validation fields are enable to change
Click the Message on Error of Required input field
Message on Error field is focused.
Enter 'Please enter the first name.' as message on error
Message on error field displays entered text 'Please enter the first name.'
Checkbox for Min Length is selected
Click the Value of Min Length input field
Enter "2" as value of Min Length
Click the Message on Error of Min Length input field
Enter "Minimum length is 2." as Message on Error of Min Length
Message on error field displays entered text "Minimum length is 2."
Click the Value of Max Length input field
Enter "10" as value of Max Length
Click the Message on Error of Max Length input field
Enter "Maximum length is 10." as Message on Error of Max Length
Message on error field displays entered text "Maximum length is 10."
Enter 'Please enter age.' as message on error
Message on error field displays entered text 'Please enter age.'
Click the Value of Min input field
Click the Message on Error of Min input field
Enter "Minimum age is 19." as Message on Error of Min
Message on error field displays entered text "Minimum age is 19."
Click the Value of Max input field
Click the Message on Error of Max input field
Enter "Maximum age is 65." as Message on Error of Max
Message on error field displays entered text "Maximum age is 65."
Enter 'Please enter the phone number.' as message on error
Message on error field displays entered text 'Please enter the phone number.'
Select second radio button at pattern field
Click the Message on Error of Pattern input field
Enter "Phone number format." as message on error
Message on error field displays entered text "Phone number format."
Drag 'Date of Birth' to Drop here Entity
Enter 'Please select the date of birth.' as message on error
Message on error field displays entered text 'Please select the date of birth.'
Drag 'Email Address' to Drop here Entity
Enter 'Please enter the email.' as message on error
Message on error field displays entered text 'Please enter the email.'
Click Predefined dropdown at pattern field
Enter "Email Format" as message on error
Message on error field displays entered text "Email Format"
Enter 'Please enter the gender.' as message on error
Message on error field displays entered text 'Please enter the gender.'
Enter 'Please enter only one character.' as message on error
Message on error field displays entered text 'Please enter only one character.'
Condition field displays entered text if(value !== "M" && value !== "W") "Please enter only M or W";
Click 'Save' icon on the top on the top right tool bar
Click 'Publish' button on the top right tool bar
Already published data from Data Modeler
Form lists are shown on the left pane
Click 'Component' tab at the left side window
Drag and drop 'Fieldset' to the canvas
Drag and drop 'Grid Layout' component inside 'Fieldset'

Set 'Set a Container' as below: <1col> xs: 4 sm:4 md: 4 lg: 4 xl: 4
<2 col> xs: 4 sm:4 md: 4 lg: 4 xl: 4
<3 col> xs: 4 sm:4 md: 4 lg: 4 xl: 4
All xs, sm, md, lg, and xl are set to 4
Click 'Project Schema' tab at the left side window
Drag and drop 'First Name' entity inside the first column of grid layout
'First Name' entity appears inside the first column of grid layout
Click 'Layout' tab from the right side window
Drag and drop 'Middle Name' entity inside the second column of grid layout
'Middle Name' entity appears inside the second column of grid layout
Drag and drop 'First Name' entity inside the third column of grid layout
'First Name' entity appears inside the third column of grid layout
2x3 grid layout appears under grid layout inside 'Name' Fieldset
Click 'Attribute' tab at the right side window
Set 'Set a Container' as below: <1col> xs: 12 sm:12 md: 12 lg: 12 xl: 12
xs, sm, md, lg, and xl are set to 12
Entities and Entity groups are listed
Drag and drop 'Full Name' entity inside the grid layout
'Full Name' entity appears inside the grid layout
Drag and drop 'Fieldset' to the canvas (Below 'Name' Fieldset)
Drag and drop 'Grid Layout' component inside 'Address' Fieldset

Set 'Set a Container' as below: <1col> xs: 3 sm:3 md: 3 lg: 3 xl: 3
<2 col> xs: 3 sm: 3 md: 3 lg: 3 xl: 3
<3 col> xs: 3 sm: 3 md: 3 lg: 3 xl: 3
<4 col> xs: 3 sm: 3 md: 3 lg: 3 xl: 3
All xs, sm, md, lg, and xl are set to 3
Drag and drop 'State' entity inside the first column of grid layout
'State' entity appears inside the first column of grid layout
Drag and drop 'City' entity inside the second column of grid layout
'City' entity appears inside the second column of grid layout
Drag and drop 'Zip Code' entity inside the third column of grid layout
'Zip Code' entity appears inside the third column of grid layout
Drag and drop 'Address' entity inside the fourth column of grid layout
'Address' entity appears inside the fourth column of grid layout
Drag and drop 'Fieldset' to the canvas (Below 'Address' Fieldset)
Title field displays entered text 'Other Information'
Drag and drop 'Grid Layout' component inside 'Other Information' Fieldset
2x3 grid layout appears inside 'Other Information' Fieldset

Set 'Set a Container' as below: <1col> xs: 4 sm: 4 md: 4 lg: 4 xl: 4
<2 col> xs: 4 sm: 4 md: 4 lg: 4 xl: 4
<3 col> xs: 4 sm: 4 md: 4 lg: 4 xl: 4
Drag and drop 'Phone' entity inside the first column of grid layout
'Phone' entity appears inside the first column of grid layout
Click 'Project Manager' button from the top menu bar.
'Simple Form' workspace is selected. Tree is opened and 'Simple Form' project is shown.
'Simple Form' project is selected. Tree is opened and 'Form' and 'Block' items are shown.
'New Block' modal is shown. There are two input boxes. - 'Name' input box - 'Description' input box
Enter 'Extend CSS and JS Block' into 'Name' input box.
Given values are entered into input box.
Enter 'Extend CSS and JS Block' into 'Description' input box.
Click 'Save' button at the bottom of the modal.

An alert shown up with a message as below.
Do you want to create this block?
New block is created. Under the block tree, there is a block named as 'Extend CSS and JS Block'.
Simple Form - Relationship test in the Form
Click Desktop Preview mode icon top of right the Appdev studio
Full Name Field value is 'James, Paul MaCartney'
Erase 'Paul' in the Middle Name Field and Check again Full Name Field Value
Full Name Field value cahnged to 'James, MaCartney'
Click Drop Down box at State Field
DropDown expanded and state list appear
Click Drop Down box at City Field
DropDown expanded and City list appear
Enter 'Pho' to Search Field at Drop Down box
Phoenix appear in the dropdown box
Erase 'Pho' at Search Field and Select Pearce
Erase '85255' and Enter '85118' to Zip Code Field
Click calendar icon at Date of birth field in other information Field set
01/01/1990 selected at Date of Birth Field
12/31/1990 selected at Date of Birth Field
01/01/2022 selected at Date of Birth Field
Check Validation message at bottom of Date of Birth
Date cannot be future date' displayed at bottom of Date of Birth Field
Click calendar icon at Date of birth field and Select January, 1, 2001
01/01/2001 selected at Date of Birth Field
Validation message disappear at bottom of Date of Birth Field
Click 'Preview Desktop' icon on the top right tool bar
Click the First Name input field
First Name field displays entered text "John"
Entered text "John" is removed. "Please enter the first name." displays at the bottom of First Name input field
Click calendar icon at the Date of Birth icon
Date of Birth field displays selected date "01/01/2000"
Selected date "01/01/2000" is removed. "Please select the date of birth." displays at the bottom of Date of Birth input field
Validation modal opens. First Name, Phone, Email Address, Gender, Date of Birth, Age validation display
Modal closes. "Please enter ~" or "Please select ~" message displays at the bottom of First Name, Phone, Email Address, Gender, Date of Birth, Age field
First Name field displays entered text "J". "Minimum length is 2. (1 / 2)" displays at the bottom of First Name input field
"J" is removed. "Please enter the first name." displays at the bottom of First Name input field
First Name field displays entered text "Jo". Validation message disappears
"Jo" is removed. "Please enter the first name." displays at the bottom of First Name input field
First Name field displays entered text "JohnJohnJohn" "Maximum length is 10. (12 / 10)" displays at the bottom of First Name input field
"JohnJohnJohn" is removed. "Please enter the first name." displays at the bottom of First Name input field
First Name field displays entered text "John". Validation message disappears
Date of Birth field displays selected date "01/01/2015" and Age field displays "6". "Minimum age is 19." displays at the bottom of Age input field
Date of Birth field displays selected date "01/01/1950" and Age field displays "71". "Maximum age is 65." displays at the bottom of Age input field
Date of Birth field displays selected date "01/01/2000" and Age field displays "21". Validation message disappears
Click the Email Address input field
"John" is removed. "Please enter the email." displays at the bottom of Email Address input field
Email Address field displays entered text "john@bizflow". "Email Format" displays at the bottom of Email Address input field
"john@bizflow" is removed. "Please enter the email." displays at the bottom of Email Address input field
Email Address field displays entered text "john@bizflow.com". Validation message disappears
Phone field displays entered text "010". "Phone number Format" displays at the bottom of Phone input field
"010" is removed. "Please enter the phone number." displays at the bottom of Phone input field
"010-0000" is removed. "Please enter the phone number." displays at the bottom of Phone input field
Phone field displays entered text "010-0000-0000". Validation message disappears
Gender field displays entered text "MM". "Please enter only one character." displays at the bottom of Gender input field
"MM" is removed. "Please enter the gender." displays at the bottom of Gender input field
"1" is removed. "Please enter the gender." displays at the bottom of Gender input field
Gender field displays entered text "Q". "Please enter only M or W" displays at the bottom of Gender input field
"Q" is removed. "Please enter the gender." displays at the bottom of Gender input field
"q" is removed. "Please enter the gender." displays at the bottom of Gender input field
Gender field displays entered text "A". "Please enter only M or W" displays at the bottom of Gender input field
"A" is removed. "Please enter the gender." displays at the bottom of Gender input field
Gender field displays entered text "M". No validation appears.
"M" is removed. "Please enter the gender." displays at the bottom of Gender input field
Gender field displays entered text "W". No validation appears.
'Simple Form' project is opened. List of forms are shown.
'Personal Information' form is opened in the canvas.
Click 'Extend CSS and JavaScript' button from the top menu bar.

'Extend CSS and JavaScript' modal is opened.
There are two empty textareas. - 'Extend CSS' textarea - 'Extend JavaScript' textarea
Given values are entered into textarea.
'Extend CSS and JavaScript' modal is closed.
Click 'Save' button from the top menu bar.
Click 'Preview Desktop' button from the top menu bar.

In 'Preview Desktop' window, check if all labels are in bold.
Labels with '.bf-label' : - 'First Name', 'Middle Name', 'Last Name', 'Full Name', 'State', 'City', 'Zip Code', 'Address', 'Phone', 'Email Address', 'Gender', 'Date of Birth', 'Age'
Labels with '.p-fieldset-legent-text' : - 'Name', 'Address', 'Other Information'
In AppDev Studio, click 'Extend CSS and JavaScript' button from the top menu bar.
'Extend CSS and JavaScript' modal is opened.
Textarea values are changed as given.

In 'Preview Desktop' window, check if only labels with '.bf-label' are in bold.
Labels with '.bf-label' : - 'First Name', 'Middle Name', 'Last Name', 'Full Name', 'State', 'City', 'Zip Code', 'Address', 'Phone', 'Email Address', 'Gender', 'Date of Birth', 'Age'
From AppDev Studio, click 'Extend CSS and JavaScript' button from the top menu bar.
Delete all values from 'Extend CSS' textarea.
All values are deleted, and it is empty.
In 'Preview Desktop' window, check if all labels are not in bold.
All labels are not in bold.
In 'Personal Information' form from AppDev Studio, search for a component labeled as 'Embedded Block - Extend CSS and JS Block'.
The component labeled as 'Embedded Block - Extend CSS and JS Block' can be found in the bottom of the form canvas.
Click 'Go to Block' button from 'Embedded Block - Extend CSS and JS Block' component.
New block tab 'Extened CSS and JS Block' is appeared at the top of the canvas, and this block is opened.
Click 'Personal Information' form tab at the top of the canvas.
In AppDev Studio, click 'Extened CSS and JS Block' block tab at the top of the canvas.
'Extened CSS and JS Block' block canvas is opened.
In AppDev Studio, open 'Personal Information' form.
Case4: Calling Extend JavaScript function - from 'Button' component's Event Handler function
Select 'Button Component' button in the form.

'Event' tab is opened.
There are two textareas. - 'state' textarea - 'function' textarea
Open 'Developer tools' from the 'Preview Desktop' window.
In 'Preview Desktop' window, click 'Button Component' button.

There is a console log message as below.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : Button - Click Event Handler
All values are deleted from 'function' textarea.
Case5: Calling Extend JavaScript function - from 'Form Callback' - 'Before Data'
Click 'Form Callback' button from the top menu bar.

'Form Callback' modal is opened.
'Before Data' tab is selected. There are two textareas. - 'Callback Function' textarea - 'Description' textarea

Enter below values into 'Description' textarea.
Description

Change is saved. It shows a notification with a toast with a message below.
Successfully saved.
'+' is added to the 'Before Data' tab label.
Check console tab if there is a console message.

There is a console message as below.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : Before Data Callback

'Form Callback' modal is opened.
'Before Data' tab is selected.

Modify values from 'Callback Function' textarea as below.
resume();
The values in 'Callback Function' textarea is modified.

Change is saved. It shows a notification with a toast with a message below.
Successfully saved.
Case6: Calling Extend JavaScript function - from 'Form Callback' - 'After Data'
Select 'After Data' tab from the tab list in 'Form Callback' modal.
Select 'First Name' entity from 'Form Schema' list at the left side of the modal.
Drag 'First Name' entity and drop onto the box with a message, 'Drag here to add (Data)'.

Dropped entity is shown below the 'Drag here …' box.
First Name data.a ( i icon) (trashcan icon)
* 'data.a' can be different in your environment. i.e) data.b, data.c, data.d, etc.

Given values are entered into textarea.
* In case the alias for data entity, data.a, is different in your environment, enter the alias name shown in your environment. i.e) data.b, data.c, data.d, etc.

Change is saved. It shows a notification with a toast with a message below.
Successfully saved.
'+' is added to the 'After Data' tab label.

There is a console message as below.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : After Data Callback - data.a = undefined
Case7: Calling Extend JavaScript function - from 'Form Callback' - 'Before Save'
Select 'Before Save' tab from the tab list in 'Form Callback' modal.

Change is saved. It shows a notification with a toast with a message below.
Successfully saved.
'+' is added to the 'Before Save' tab label.
In 'Preview Desktop' window, click 'Save without Validation' button.

'Save without Validation' button is clicked. It shows a notification with a toast with a message below.
Saved successfully.

There is a console message as below.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : Before Save Callback - data.a = undefined
In 'Preview Desktop' window, enter 'Kim' into 'First Name' input text box.
Check console tab if there is a new console message.

There is a console message as below.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : Before Save Callback - data.a = Kim
Case8: Calling Extend JavaScript function - from 'Form Callback' - 'After Save'
Select 'After Save' tab from the tab list in 'Form Callback' modal.

Change is saved. It shows a notification with a toast with a message below.
Successfully saved.
'+' is added to the 'After Save' tab label.

There is a console message as below.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : After Save Callback - data.a = undefined

There is a console message as below.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : After Save Callback - data.a = Kim
Case9: Calling Extend JavaScript function - from 'Form Callback' - 'Before Exit'
Select 'Before Exit' tab from the tab list in 'Form Callback' modal.

Change is saved. It shows a notification with a toast with a message below.
Successfully saved.
'+' is added to the 'Before Exit' tab label.

There is a console message as below.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : Before Exit Callback - data.a = undefined

There is a console message as below.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : Before Exit Callback - data.a = Kim
Case10: Calling Extend JavaScript function - from 'Form Callback' - 'After Exit'
Select 'After Exit' tab from the tab list in 'Form Callback' modal.

Change is saved. It shows a notification with a toast with a message below.
Successfully saved.
'+' is added to the 'After Exit' tab label.

There is a console message as below.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : After Exit Callback - data.a = undefined
Case11: Calling Extend JavaScript function - from 'Form Callback' - 'Data Change Listener'
Select 'Data Change Listener' tab from the tab list in 'Form Callback' modal.

'New Callback' button is changed to 'Add Callback' button.
'Drag here to add (Data)' box and 'Drag here to add (Observable)' box are enabled.

Dropped entity is shown below the 'Drag here …(Data)' box.
First Name data.a ( i icon) (trashcan icon)
* 'data.a' can be different in your environment. i.e) data.b, data.c, data.d, etc.
Drag 'First Name' entity and drop onto the box with a message, 'Drag here to add (Observable)'.

Dropped entity is shown below the 'Drag here …(Observable)' box.
First Name (trashcan icon)

'Add Callback' button is clicked.
New callback function item is added to the 'Callback Function List' area.

Change is saved. It shows a notification with a toast with a message below.
Successfully saved.
'+' is added to the 'Data Change Listener' tab label.

In 'Preview Desktop' window, enter 'Kim' into 'First Name' input text box.
Check 'Developer tools' console area for the console message, as you type 'Kim' into input text box.

As you type each letter of 'Kim' into input text box, console message is shown.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : Data Change Listener Callback - data.a = k Extend JavaScript Function called from : Data Change Listener Callback - data.a = ki Extend JavaScript Function called from : Data Change Listener Callback - data.a = kim
Click 'Modify' icon button under 'Callback Function List' area.
Selected 'Callback Function' is opened. 'Modify Callback' button is shown.

'Modify Callback' button is changed to 'Add Callback' button.
Modification is applied to the 'Callback Function List' area.
Case12: Calling Extend JavaScript function - from 'Form Callback' - 'State Change Listener'
Click '+1' button at the end of tab list.
Hidden 'State Change Listener' tab is shown under the '+1' button.
Select 'State Change Listener' tab from the tab list in 'Form Callback' modal.
Look for 'formAction' state from 'State & rState' list on the left side of the modal.

'formAction' state is listed under 'state'.
state: { … … formAction: a reserved state variable for form actions … … }, …
Drag 'formAction' state and drop onto the box with a message, 'Drag here to add (Observable)'.

Dropped entity is shown below the 'Drag here …(Data)' box.
formAction (trashcan icon)

Change is saved. It shows a notification with a toast with a message below.
Successfully saved.
'+' is added to the 'State Change Listener' tab label.
In the 'Personal Information' form canvas, select 'Button Component' button.
In 'Developer tools' window, check console tab if there is a new console message.

A console message is shown as below.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : State Change Listener Callback - state.formAction = BUTTON

A console message is shown as below.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : State Change Listener Callback - state.formAction = SAVE

A console message is shown as below.
Extend JavaScript Function called from : State Change Listener Callback - state.formAction = EXIT
Remove "This fields can be entered maximum of 100 character(s)." entered
"This fields can be entered maximum of 100 character(s)." is removed
Click calendar icon at the Date of Birth icon
Email Address field displays entered text "john". "Email Format" displays at the bottom of Email Address input field
Phone field displays entered text "010-0000". "Phone number Format" displays at the bottom of Phone input field
Gender field displays entered text "1". "Please enter only one character." displays at the bottom of Gender input field
Gender field displays entered text "q". "Please enter only M or W" displays at the bottom of Gender input field
